record.title: Rosa Winkel? Das ist doch schon lange vorbei ... | Detlef Stoffel, Person2298, Person2300 [1976]
record.detail: Rosa Winkel? Das ist doch schon lange vorbei ...

record.title: Rosa Winkel
record.detail: The pink triangle used in Nazi concentraion camps to mark prisoners identified as homosexual men. In the 1970th this symbol was reappropriated by gay rights activists. It was worn to commemorate past vitims and ongoing discrimination.

record.title: David Wilkerson
record.detail: David Ray Wilkerson was an American Christian evangelist, best known for his book The Cross and the Switchblade. He was the founder of the addiction recovery program Teen Challenge, and founding pastor of the non-denominational Times Square Church in New York City.

record.title: Kor_A_015.pdf | Detlef Stoffel: Letter to AG (DE) [30 Jun 1973] | Mentions - > David Wilkerson

detail.name: Source record
detail.basename: Source record pointer INTERNAL USE ONLY

detail.name: Target record
detail.basename: Target record pointer INTERNAL USE ONLY

record.title: Global Teen Challenge
record.detail: Global Teen Challenge is a network of Christian faith-based corporations intended to provide rehabilitation services to people struggling with addiction. It was founded by David Wilkerson in 1961. The global headquarters is in Columbus, Georgia, United States. There is little public record of what goes on in Teen Challenge facilities. Questions have been raised about whether the practices of the organization are abusive and cult-like. In the United States, there are no federal laws or agencies that regulate organizations like Teen Challenge.

record.title: Global Teen Challenge | Administrative.has Leader - > David Wilkerson
